title: Logistics Assistant Job at Talent-Nest Recruitment Hub
content:
Talent-Nest Recruitment Hub - We are a forward-thinking renewable energy company committed to accelerating the transition to clean and sustainable power solutions. Our portfolio spans solar PV, wind, battery storage, and hybrid energy systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Assistant

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Logistics Assistant to support our supply chain and logistics operations.
	The ideal candidate will assist in coordinating the movement of goods, tracking deliveries, maintaining records, and ensuring timely and efficient logistics support for the company’s activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning and coordinating the movement of goods and materials.
	Prepare and process shipping, delivery, and procurement documents.
	Track incoming and outgoing shipments to ensure timely delivery.
	Support the preparation of delivery schedules and route planning.
	Handle basic warehouse tasks, including labeling, packing, and stock arrangement.
	Maintain accurate records of inventory, stock levels, and logistics activities.
	Liaise with vendors, transporters, and suppliers for smooth operations.
	Assist in resolving logistics-related issues promptly.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and safety regulations.


Requirements


	OND / HND / BSc Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	2 - 3 years of experience in logistics, supply chain, or warehouse operations.
	Strong organisational and multitasking skills.
	Computer literacy (MS Word, Excel, and basic inventory software).
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Physical stamina to handle warehouse or delivery support tasks when necessary.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: frederickdamilare@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

	We are hiring&nbsp;Golang engineers of all levels of seniority, for all relevant teams at Canonical. Apply here if you are an exceptional software engineer who prefers to work in Go. After the first round of interviews we&rsquo;ll find the best fit product team at Canonical for you to progress your application based on your personal interests.
	Canonical prefers Golang for software where performance and security are primary considerations. We also have substantial projects in Python, C, C++ and are starting to invest in Rust. For front-end development we prefer React and Flutter.
	Golang is an essential language for our engineering teams, who build the systems that deliver Ubuntu to the world. From our software distribution systems, to those which build and test every possible kind of open source on every architecture, from our systems management tools to our distributed systems operations R&amp;D, we count on Golang for its tasteful concurrency and developer ecosystem. Juju, Livepatch, LXD, MAAS, Microk8s, Snapd, Ubuntu Core, Ubuntu Pro, and many more Canonical offerings include Golang components.
	We also want to ensure that Ubuntu is the very best platform for Golang development, offering easy access to the widest range of tooling and capabilities that support cutting edge open source and enterprise development.
	Join us in our mission to deliver innovative open-source solutions to individuals and enterprises around the world. We expect the highest engineering standards and strong motivation to get things done well in a fully remote and distributed environment. These roles require extensive personal experience with Linux - the more different versions of Linux the better! We have open roles for Golang engineers in every time zone


Responsibilities
The role entails:


	Design and implement well-tested and documented software in Go
	Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
	Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
	Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
	Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
	In some cases, deploy and operate services developed by the team

	Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
	Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations

	Experience with Juju, LXD, Microk8s, Snapd, Ubuntu Core, Ubuntu Pro
	Performance engineering and security experience

	Annual compensation review

	Maternity and paternity leave

Business Development Representative Job at Mantrac




        
    

        
        Mantrac is the sole distributor for Caterpillar products in Nigeria, distributing and supporting machinery, power systems and material-handling equipment. The company provides customers with comprehensive solutions, backed by technical know-how, experience and in-depth knowledge of their local markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Representative

Job Location: Lagos

Summary of Responsibilties
     

            
    




	A Business Development Representative (BDR) is office based.
	The BDR will make telephone/email contact with, suspects, prospects and lapsed customers to identify opportunities and generate sales leads for Mantrac.
	The BDR will also handle all incoming enquiries whether by phone, email or personal visit.


Main Functions


	Qualify assigned leads, prospects, suspects and lapsed customers by telephone.
	Conduct telephone marketing campaigns as and when required with a view to generating new leads and opportunities.
	Handle all incoming calls, web leads and walk in customers with a view to identifying new opportunities.
	Use Sales Force to update all activities by completing all relevant information including customer details, population, opportunity and follow up
	Assign leads to ISR/TSR dependent on Ground Rules
	Maintain sufficient customer narrative (record of each conversation) to sufficiently educate the salesperson to make the lead transfer seamless for the potential customer. Summarize on Sales Force.
	Transfer leads to the appropriate salesperson in a timely and efficient manner and ensure it matches customer expectation.
	Actively manage customer list to ensure follow up calls are made at pre-agreed times in order to maximize participation.
	Complete 25 successful suspect, prospect or customer calls per day.
	Verify and update contact information for suspects, prospects and customers as per standard Mantrac Sales Force defined process.
	Continue to develop expertise in products and services through SDPC training, research and perpetual learning.
	Expand contacts within Mantrac as a resource for customers.
	Recommend dealer solutions to reduce customer owning and operating costs and demonstrate value.
	Maximize prime product opportunities, parts and service sales by promoting all aspects of the dealer’s offerings.
	Establish a personal working relationship with contacts based on value, knowledge, trust and character.
	Monitor and report all pertinent market information relative to competitive activity, customer information and product performance.
	Achieve the planned annual rate of call (PAR) for each assigned account.


Relevant Information


	B.Sc Degree in Engineering or equivalent.
	At least 2 years of experience in the industry (sales, marketing & technical experience).
	Good written and spoken English.
	Interpersonal and communication skills. Leadership skills and ability to take initiative.
	Math Ability: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as averages, percentages, geometry, and statistics.
	Computer Skills: Demonstrate proficiency in the software applications of Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint; Sales Force, desirable but training will be given.
